author: Deepa H
text:
Many of the sitting AIADMK MLAs are on tenterhooks as the leadership is yet to call them for interview for ticket.

The MLAs are confused over why they had not been called till now. “May be, this is just the initial phase. Amma will call us later,” says an MLA in Chennai.

Party seniors admit that not many sitting MLAs had been called over to Poes Garden. Perhaps party supremo Jayalalithaa is looking for fresh faces – has been the common refrain. According to party sources, around 50 candidates who had applied for ticket from constituencies in Tiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Vellore, Dindigul and Madurai districts were called to Poes Garden for the interview on Tuesday.

But from Tirunelveli district, none of the sitting MLAs appeared for the interview, sources in the district confirmed.

Not many might get to contest again in the May 16 elections due to various reasons, they added.

“ Amma gives opportunities to youth as they have more energy and can devote more time to serve the people,” claimed a party senior. In the first round, Ms. Jayalalithaa interviewed former MLA of R. K. Nagar, P. Vetrivel, who vacated his seat for her. Chennai Corporation Deputy Mayor Benjamin, Chennai Corporation Councillor Noorjahan Beevi, former member of Parliament Chitlapakkam Rajendran and sitting Uthankarai MLA Manoranjitham Nagaraj were also interviewed.

( With additional inputs from P. Sudhakar in Tirunelveli )
title: Not many AIADMK MLAs interviewed
